title: How to Make Unicorn Ice Cream

steps.headline: Beat the whipping cream in a large bowl.
steps.description: Use an electric mixer to beat the cream on high speed for about 3-4 minutes, until peaks begin to form.

steps.headline: Add the sweetened condensed milk and vanilla.
steps.description: Beat on high speed until fully combined.

steps.headline: Divide the whipping cream mixture into 4-5 bowls.
Add 3-4 drops of a gel food color into each bowl.
steps.description: Mix each color well with a spoon until the color is vibrant.

steps.headline: Layer the colors on a container.
steps.description: Place each colored whipped cream in a freezer-proof container using a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Gently swirl the colors around using a kabob skewer or butter knife.
steps.description: Sprinkle the disco dust and sprinkles over the ice cream, if desired. This gives the ice cream a more unicorn-themed look and enhances the beauty of it. Don't stir the colors - this will mix them together and ruin the unicorn effect. You want to run the skewer or knife through the colors in a straight line, rather than in a circular motion.

steps.headline: Freeze the ice cream.
steps.description: Cover the container with plastic wrap or a lid. Freeze the unicorn ice cream for about 8 hours or overnight, until the ice cream is fully solid.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Using an ice cream scoop, scoop the ice cream into a serving bowl. Garnish with sprinkles, disco dust, and/or whipped cream. Enjoy!
